body:
**Missing `mode` changes behavior**

`resolveCronDeliveryPlan` now defaults `delivery.mode` to `"announce"` when a `delivery` object exists but `mode` is absent (`const resolvedMode = mode ?? "announce"`). That means a partially-specified delivery object like `{ channel, to }` will start sending announcements even if older stores/clients wrote delivery configs without a mode. If existing persisted jobs can have `delivery` without `mode` (likely during migrations/older versions), this is a behavior change that will result in unexpected outbound messages.

If the intent is to be backwards-compatible and safe-by-default, keep the default as `"none"` (or require `mode` explicitly) and only announce when `mode` is set to `announce`/`deliver`.

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: src/cron/delivery.ts
Line: 52:55

Comment:
**Missing `mode` changes behavior**

`resolveCronDeliveryPlan` now defaults `delivery.mode` to `"announce"` when a `delivery` object exists but `mode` is absent (`const resolvedMode = mode ?? "announce"`). That means a partially-specified delivery object like `{ channel, to }` will start sending announcements even if older stores/clients wrote delivery configs without a mode. If existing persisted jobs can have `delivery` without `mode` (likely during migrations/older versions), this is a behavior change that will result in unexpected outbound messages.

If the intent is to be backwards-compatible and safe-by-default, keep the default as `"none"` (or require `mode` explicitly) and only announce when `mode` is set to `announce`/`deliver`.

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>
